body_html: @apaszke @soumith Well, the problem is called dll hell on Windows. Presently, it mostly lies on openmp, vs2017 and numpy. For the two first two, next time we can pack them into the package for wheels. But for numpy, because we built it with MKL, so we need numpy-mkl. However, numpy or numpy-mkl is not on official pypi server for Windows. So we may should write this into the install instructions.

body: @apaszke @soumith Well, the problem is called dll hell on Windows. Presently, it mostly lies on openmp, vs2017 and numpy. For the two first two, next time we can pack them into the package for wheels. But for numpy, because we built it with MKL, so we need numpy-mkl. However, numpy or numpy-mkl is not on official pypi server for Windows. So we may should write this into the install instructions.
